title: Character Races & Classes
description: Complete guide to character creation, races, and classes in Stepcraft
content:
# Character Races & Classes In Stepcraft, your character's race and class define your starting abilities, appearance, and storyline. Each race has unique traits, starting locations, and quest lines that shape your adventure. ## Playable Races ### Elf

Starting Location: Willow's Reach

Element: Nature & Forest Magic

Philosophy: Harmony with Nature

**Racial Traits:** * Natural affinity for nature magic and healing * Enhanced agility and dexterity * Starting bonus to Alchemy and Foraging skills * Access to unique Elven quest line **Background:** Elves are forest dwellers who live in harmony with nature. Your journey begins during the "Giving Days," a coming-of-age tradition where young elves prove themselves to their community. As an elf, you'll start your adventure in the Heart Grove under the guidance of Elder Mirae. **Racial Quest Line:** The Giving Begins → Festival Preparations → From Field to Feast → Storm Damage → The Herbalist's Need → Mushrooms and Medicine → A Cry for Help → The Ruins' Secret → The Gleaming Prophecy → The Elder's Wisdom ### Human

Starting Location: Sunforge Sands

Element: Innovation & Trade

Philosophy: Progress through Unity

*Coming Soon - Under Development* ### Dwarf

Starting Location: Ironheart Cliffs

Element: Earth & Metal

Philosophy: Strength through Craft

*Coming Soon - Under Development* ### Orc

Starting Location: Moonmere

Element: Spirit & Honor

Philosophy: Power through Struggle

*Coming Soon - Under Development* ## Character Customization ### Avatar Selection Choose from multiple avatar variations for each race:

Female Elf

Male Elf

Variant 1

Variant 2

* **Male and Female Options:** Each race offers 24 unique male and 24 unique female avatars * **Visual Diversity:** Each avatar has distinct facial features, hair styles, and coloring * **Racial Characteristics:** Avatars reflect the unique traits of their respective races ### Starting Stats All characters begin with base stats that can be improved through gameplay: * **Health Points (HP):** Your character's life force * **Attack:** Physical damage dealt in combat * **Defense:** Resistance to incoming damage * **Agility:** Movement speed and dodge chance * **Critical Chance:** Probability of dealing critical damage

title: Character Races
description: Complete guide to all playable races in Stepcraft - their traits, lore, and unique characteristics
content:
# Character Races Choose your heritage wisely, as your race determines not only your appearance but also your starting location, initial abilities, cultural background, and unique storyline. Each race offers a distinct gameplay experience with specialized strengths and rich lore. ## Race Overview

Elves

Forest Guardians

Masters of nature magic and ancient wisdom, living in harmony with the forest.

Territory: Willow's Reach
Element: Nature & Life
Philosophy: Balance and Harmony

Humans

Desert Innovators

Adaptable traders and inventors who thrive in harsh desert conditions through ingenuity.

Territory: Sunforge Sands
Element: Fire & Innovation
Philosophy: Progress through Unity

Dwarves

Mountain Crafters

Master smiths and engineers who have carved magnificent cities into mountain peaks.

Territory: Ironheart Cliffs
Element: Earth & Metal
Philosophy: Strength through Craft

Orcs

Marsh Warriors

Proud warriors who follow ancient codes of honor in the mystical wetlands.

Territory: Moonmere
Element: Spirit & Water
Philosophy: Honor through Struggle
*** # Detailed Race Profiles ## Elves - The Forest Guardians

Quick Facts

Lifespan: 800-1200 years
Height: 5'6" - 6'2"
Build: Slender and graceful
Hair: Often silver, gold, or auburn
Eyes: Green, blue, or violet
### History & Culture Elves are the ancient guardians of Willow's Reach, a mystical forest realm where nature and magic intertwine. For millennia, they have lived in perfect harmony with their environment, developing a deep understanding of natural cycles, healing arts, and the delicate balance that sustains all life. Their society is built around the **Heart Grove**, a sacred grove centered on an enormous World Tree whose roots span the entire forest. This tree is not merely a landmark—it's a living connection to the natural world that guides elven philosophy and decision-making. ### The Giving Days Tradition Every young elf must complete the **Giving Days**, a coming-of-age ritual where they prove their worth to the community through acts of service. This tradition teaches that true strength comes not from individual achievement, but from contribution to the greater good. ### Racial Traits & Abilities **Natural Affinity:** * **Enhanced Alchemy** - Start with bonus experience in potion brewing * **Foraging Mastery** - Natural ability to find rare herbs and mushrooms * **Nature's Blessing** - Increased health regeneration in forest environments * **Keen Senses** - Better detection of hidden resources and secrets **Combat Specialization:** * **Agility Focus** - Natural grace provides dodge bonuses * **Archery Expertise** - Traditional elven weapon training * **Defensive Magic** - Access to protective nature spells **Social Benefits:** * **Forest Network** - Better prices with nature-aligned vendors * **Ancient Wisdom** - Access to unique dialogue options * **Diplomatic Heritage** - Bonus reputation with neutral factions ### Starting Location: Willow's Reach Begin your journey in the mystical forests of Willow's Reach, where ancient trees whisper secrets and magical energy flows through every leaf. Your adventure starts at the Heart Grove under the guidance of Elder Mirae, the wise leader of your community. **Key Starting Areas:** * **Heart Grove** - Sacred center and quest hub * **Willowbend Plaza** - Trading post and crafting stations * **Blooming Glade** - Agricultural learning area * **Mycelwood Thicket** - Foraging and alchemy training ### Avatar Customization
Choose from 24 unique male and 24 unique female elven avatars, each with distinct facial features, hair styles, and natural coloring that reflects their forest heritage.
*** ## Humans - The Desert Innovators

Quick Facts

Lifespan: 60-80 years
Height: 5'4" - 6'0"
Build: Varied and adaptable
Hair: All natural colors
Eyes: Brown, blue, green, hazel
### History & Culture Humans have claimed the challenging **Sunforge Sands** as their domain, transforming a harsh desert landscape into a thriving center of trade and innovation. Through ingenuity, cooperation, and relentless determination, they have built magnificent cities around life-giving oases. Their society values **progress through unity**—the belief that by working together and sharing knowledge, humanity can overcome any obstacle. This philosophy has made them natural traders, diplomats, and inventors. ### The Merchant's Calling Human culture revolves around the great **Trade Routes** that connect distant lands. Young humans often begin their adult lives by joining merchant caravans, learning the ways of commerce, negotiation, and the diverse cultures they encounter. ### Racial Traits & Abilities **Adaptability:** * **Quick Learner** - Gain experience 10% faster in all skills * **Jack of All Trades** - No skill penalties, balanced growth * **Heat Resistance** - Reduced damage from fire and desert conditions * **Resource Efficiency** - Tools and equipment last longer **Combat Specialization:** * **Weapon Versatility** - Can effectively use any weapon type * **Tactical Mind** - Bonus to combat strategy and formation fighting * **Endurance Training** - Higher stamina and longer combat duration **Social Benefits:** * **Born Traders** - Better prices with all merchants * **Cultural Bridge** - Easier reputation gains with all races * **Leadership Qualities** - Bonus to group activities and quests ### Starting Location: Sunforge Sands *Coming with the Human expansion - Under Development* Begin your adventure in the bustling oasis cities of Sunforge Sands, where merchants from across the world gather to trade exotic goods and share tales of distant lands. ### Future Content The human storyline and territories are currently under development. Stay tuned for: * Merchant guild questlines * Desert exploration and survival * Trade route management * Innovation and invention systems * Cross-cultural diplomacy challenges
*** ## Dwarves - The Mountain Crafters

Quick Facts

Lifespan: 200-300 years
Height: 4'0" - 4'8"
Build: Stocky and muscular
Hair: Usually braided, all colors
Eyes: Brown, amber, gray
### History & Culture Dwarves have made the treacherous **Ironheart Cliffs** their ancestral home, carving magnificent cities directly into the mountain faces. Masters of engineering and craftsmanship, they have turned solid rock into works of art that rival nature's own creations. Their culture is built on the principle of **strength through craft**—the belief that true power comes not from conquest, but from the ability to create, build, and improve. Every dwarf takes immense pride in their chosen craft, whether it's smithing, engineering, or gem-cutting. ### The Forge Masters Dwarven society is organized around the **Great Forges**, massive workshop complexes that never cease their production. These forges are not just workplaces—they're centers of learning, tradition, and community life. ### Racial Traits & Abilities **Crafting Mastery:** * **Master Smiths** - Exceptional bonus to smithing and metallurgy * **Gem Expertise** - Enhanced ability to find and cut precious stones * **Engineering Genius** - Access to advanced construction and mechanisms * **Tool Mastery** - All crafting tools are 50% more effective **Combat Specialization:** * **Heavy Armor Proficiency** - No movement penalties from armor * **Axe and Hammer Mastery** - Traditional dwarven weapon expertise * **Mountain Endurance** - Resistance to physical damage and fatigue **Social Benefits:** * **Craftsman's Network** - Exceptional prices for crafted goods * **Ancient Grudges** - Complex relationships with other races * **Clan Honor** - Reputation affects entire communities ### Starting Location: Ironheart Cliffs *Coming with the Dwarf expansion - Under Development* Begin in the magnificent mountain cities of Ironheart Cliffs, where the ring of hammers on anvils echoes through carved stone halls, and every surface tells the story of masterful craftsmanship. ### Future Content The dwarven experience is currently in development: * Clan-based questlines and politics * Advanced crafting and engineering systems * Underground exploration and mining expeditions * Ancient dwarven mysteries and lost technologies * Inter-clan relationships and rivalries
*** ## Orcs - The Marsh Warriors

Quick Facts

Lifespan: 50-70 years
Height: 5'8" - 6'6"
Build: Powerful and imposing
Hair: Dark colors, often braided
Eyes: Red, amber, yellow, brown
### History & Culture Orcs inhabit the mystical **Moonmere**, a realm of wetlands and marshes where the boundaries between the physical and spiritual worlds blur. Far from the savage stereotype, orcs are deeply spiritual people who follow ancient codes of honor and respect. Their philosophy of **honor through struggle** teaches that true strength is forged in adversity, and that facing challenges head-on—whether in combat, nature, or life—builds character and wisdom. ### The Spirit Walkers Orcish culture is guided by **Spirit Walkers**, shamanic leaders who commune with the ancestors and natural spirits that dwell in Moonmere's mists. These spiritual guides help maintain the balance between the living and the dead. ### Racial Traits & Abilities **Spiritual Connection:** * **Spirit Sight** - Can perceive hidden magical auras and spiritual entities * **Ancestral Wisdom** - Access to ancient knowledge and forgotten lore * **Marsh Navigation** - No movement penalties in wetland environments * **Night Vision** - Enhanced sight in darkness and low light **Combat Specialization:** * **Berserker Rage** - Temporary massive damage increase when health is low * **Intimidation** - Natural fear effect on weaker enemies * **Weapon Improvisation** - Can effectively use improvised weapons **Social Benefits:** * **Tribal Bonds** - Strong loyalty systems within orc communities * **Honor Code** - Reputation system based on deeds and challenges * **Spiritual Guidance** - Access to unique shamanic questlines ### Starting Location: Moonmere *Coming with the Orc expansion - Under Development* Begin your journey in the misty wetlands of Moonmere, where ancient spirits walk among the living and every challenge is an opportunity to prove your worth and honor. ### Future Content The orcish experience awaits development: * Tribal honor and challenge systems * Shamanic magic and spirit communication * Wetland survival and navigation * Ancient burial grounds and spiritual sites * Inter-tribal politics and alliance building
*** ## Choosing Your Race ### Gameplay Considerations **For New Players:** * **Elves** offer the most content currently available with a complete questline * **Humans** will provide balanced gameplay suitable for all playstyles (when released) **For Crafting Focus:** * **Dwarves** will excel at smithing and engineering (when released) * **Elves** specialize in alchemy and nature-based crafting **For Combat Enthusiasts:** * **Orcs** will offer the most intense combat experience (when released) * **Humans** provide versatile combat options **For Exploration:** * **Elves** have rich forest environments to discover * **All races** will offer unique regional exploration experiences ### Development Status * ✅ **Elves** - Fully playable with complete questline * 🔄 **Humans** - In development * 🔄 **Dwarves** - In development * 🔄 **Orcs** - In development ## Next Steps * **[Elf Questline →](/docs/quests/race-quests/elf)** - Explore the complete elven story * **[Character Classes →](/docs/characters/classes)** - Learn about future class specializations * **[Starting Skills →](/docs/skills)** - Understand racial skill bonuses * **[World Guide →](/docs/world)** - Discover your starting territory

    ### The Giving Days Tradition

    Every young elf must complete the

, a coming-of-age ritual where they prove their worth to the community through acts of service. This tradition teaches that true strength comes not from individual achievement, but from contribution to the greater good.

    ### Racial Traits & Abilities

## Humans - The Desert Innovators

Quick Facts

Lifespan: 60-80 years
Height: 5'4" - 6'0"
Build: Varied and adaptable
Hair: All natural colors
Eyes: Brown, blue, green, hazel
### History & Culture Humans have claimed the challenging

as their domain, transforming a harsh desert landscape into a thriving center of trade and innovation. Through ingenuity, cooperation, and relentless determination, they have built magnificent cities around life-giving oases.

    Their society values

—the belief that by working together and sharing knowledge, humanity can overcome any obstacle. This philosophy has made them natural traders, diplomats, and inventors.

    ### The Merchant's Calling

    Human culture revolves around the great

that connect distant lands. Young humans often begin their adult lives by joining merchant caravans, learning the ways of commerce, negotiation, and the diverse cultures they encounter.

    ### Racial Traits & Abilities

## Dwarves - The Mountain Crafters

Quick Facts

Lifespan: 200-300 years
Height: 4'0" - 4'8"
Build: Stocky and muscular
Hair: Usually braided, all colors
Eyes: Brown, amber, gray
### History & Culture Dwarves have made the treacherous

their ancestral home, carving magnificent cities directly into the mountain faces. Masters of engineering and craftsmanship, they have turned solid rock into works of art that rival nature's own creations.

    Their culture is built on the principle of

—the belief that true power comes not from conquest, but from the ability to create, build, and improve. Every dwarf takes immense pride in their chosen craft, whether it's smithing, engineering, or gem-cutting.

    ### The Forge Masters

    Dwarven society is organized around the

, massive workshop complexes that never cease their production. These forges are not just workplaces—they're centers of learning, tradition, and community life.

    ### Racial Traits & Abilities

## Orcs - The Marsh Warriors

Quick Facts

Lifespan: 50-70 years
Height: 5'8" - 6'6"
Build: Powerful and imposing
Hair: Dark colors, often braided
Eyes: Red, amber, yellow, brown
### History & Culture Orcs inhabit the mystical

, a realm of wetlands and marshes where the boundaries between the physical and spiritual worlds blur. Far from the savage stereotype, orcs are deeply spiritual people who follow ancient codes of honor and respect.

    Their philosophy of

teaches that true strength is forged in adversity, and that facing challenges head-on—whether in combat, nature, or life—builds character and wisdom.

    ### The Spirit Walkers

    Orcish culture is guided by

, shamanic leaders who commune with the ancestors and natural spirits that dwell in Moonmere's mists. These spiritual guides help maintain the balance between the living and the dead.

    ### Racial Traits & Abilities

title: Welcome to Stepcraft
description: Your first steps into the world of Stepcraft - everything you need to know to begin your adventure
content:
# Welcome to Stepcraft

Welcome, adventurer! Stepcraft is an immersive RPG experience where you'll embark on epic quests, master various skills, and explore a rich fantasy world. This guide will help you get started on your journey.

## What is Stepcraft?

Stepcraft is a mobile RPG that combines classic fantasy elements with modern gameplay mechanics. You'll:

* **Create Your Character:** Choose from multiple races, each with unique abilities and storylines
* **Master Skills:** Develop expertise in combat, crafting, gathering, and social interactions
* **Explore the World:** Discover diverse regions, from mystical forests to ancient ruins
* **Complete Quests:** Follow engaging storylines and help NPCs with their challenges
* **Craft Equipment:** Create weapons, armor, and tools to enhance your abilities
* **Battle Enemies:** Face off against a variety of creatures and monsters

## Getting Started

### 1. Character Creation

Your adventure begins with creating your character. You'll need to:

* **Choose a Race:** Each race has unique traits and starting locations
* **Select Your Avatar:** Pick from 24 male or 24 female appearance options
* **Customize Your Look:** Fine-tune your character's appearance

### 2. Learn the Basics

* **Movement:** Navigate the world by tapping locations on your map
* **Skills:** Practice different skills to level up and unlock new abilities
* **Inventory:** Manage your items, equipment, and resources
* **Quests:** Accept and complete missions from NPCs

### 3. First Steps

1. **Complete Your Race Questline:** Each race has a unique starting story
2. **Learn Basic Skills:** Try gathering, crafting, and combat
3. **Explore Your Starting Area:** Familiarize yourself with local locations
4. **Meet NPCs:** Talk to characters to learn about the world and get quests

## Core Game Systems

### Skills & Progression

Stepcraft features a comprehensive skill system:

* **Combat Skills:** Fighting, agility, and battle tactics
* **Gathering Skills:** Mining, woodcutting, fishing, farming, foraging, hunting
* **Crafting Skills:** Smithing, carpentry, alchemy, cooking, trinketry, brewing
* **Social Skills:** Reputation and faction standing

### Equipment & Items

* **Weapons:** Swords, axes, bows, and magical implements
* **Armor:** Helmets, chest pieces, gloves, boots, and accessories
* **Tools:** Pickaxes, axes, fishing rods, and sickles for gathering
* **Consumables:** Food, potions, and temporary enhancement items

### Combat System

* **Turn-Based Combat:** Strategic battles with timing elements
* **Equipment Stats:** Attack, defense, health, agility, and critical chance
* **Enemy Variety:** Face slimes, golems, undead, and mythical creatures

## Tips for New Players

### Resource Management

* **Inventory Space:** Keep track of your carrying capacity
* **Gold:** Save money for important equipment upgrades
* **Materials:** Store crafting materials for future projects

### Skill Development

* **Balance Your Skills:** Don't focus on just one area
* **Complete Quests:** They often provide skill experience as rewards
* **Practice Regularly:** Use skills frequently to level them up

### Exploration

* **Map Knowledge:** Learn the locations of important areas
* **Resource Spots:** Remember where to find specific materials
* **NPC Locations:** Know where to find quest givers and vendors

## Next Steps

Ready to begin your adventure? Here's what to explore next:

* **[Character Creation Guide →](/docs/characters)** - Learn about races and character options
* **[Skills Overview →](/docs/skills)** - Understand the skill system
* **[Quest Guide →](/docs/quests)** - Discover available questlines
* **[World Map →](/docs/world)** - Explore locations and regions

## Need Help?

This wiki contains comprehensive information about all aspects of Stepcraft. Use the navigation menu to find specific topics, or browse through the different sections to learn more about the game.

Welcome to your adventure, and may your journey be filled with discovery and triumph!

title: Individual Item Pages
description: Individual pages for Stepcraft items with detailed information
content:
# Individual Item Pages

This directory contains individual pages for Stepcraft items. Each item has its own dedicated page with detailed information, stats, and requirements.

## Sample Items Available

We have generated sample pages for items across all major categories:

### Tools

* [Copper Pickaxe](/items/individual/copper_pickaxe) - Basic mining tool
* [Iron Pickaxe](/items/individual/iron_pickaxe) - Improved mining tool

### Food

* [Bread](/items/individual/bread) - Basic staple food
* [Chocolate Cake](/items/individual/chocolate_cake) - Elite dessert

### Potions

* [Small Health Potion](/items/individual/health_potion_small) - Basic healing
* [Berserk Potion](/items/individual/berserk_potion) - Combat enhancement

### Rings

* [Copper Band](/items/individual/copper_band) - Entry level ring
* [Crimson Shard](/items/individual/crimson_shard) - Legendary ring

### Weapons

* [Basic Sword](/items/individual/basic_sword) - Entry level sword
* [Staff of the Tempest](/items/individual/tempest_staff) - Legendary staff

## How to Access

Individual item pages are accessible via direct URLs using the item key:

* Format: `/items/individual/[item-key]`
* Example: `/items/individual/copper_pickaxe`

## Search Integration

These pages are automatically indexed by the search system, making all items easily discoverable through the search functionality.

## Navigation

* [← Back to Items Catalog](/items)
* [Browse Complete Catalog](/items)

title: Resources Catalog Overview
description: Comprehensive overview of all resource categories, crafting materials, and trading goods in Stepcraft
content:
# Resources Catalog Overview Welcome to the complete resources catalog for Stepcraft! This page provides an overview of all 212 resources organized into 14 distinct categories, from basic crafting materials to rare gems and specialized components. ## Quick Navigation

Tool Parts

6 items

Ores

7 items

Gems

18 items

Bars

7 items

Logs

7 items

Planks

7 items

Handles

6 items

Fish

57 items

Farming

21 items

Foraging

29 items

Hunting

28 items

Combat

4 items
## Resource Categories ### Crafting Materials **Tool Parts & Components** * Essential components for crafting advanced tools * Includes toolheads from copper to red tier * Used in smithing and tool assembly **Ores & Raw Materials** * Base materials extracted through mining * Stone, copper, iron, silver, gold, blue, and red ores * Foundation for most crafting recipes **Refined Materials** * Bars: Processed metals ready for crafting * Planks: Processed wood for construction and tools * Handles: Specialized components for tool assembly ### Natural Resources **Gems & Precious Materials** * 18 different gems for trinketry and decoration * Used in creating rings, amulets, and high-tier equipment * Valuable trading commodities **Logs & Wood** * Raw wood materials from different tree types * Essential for carpentry and construction * Fuel source for various crafting processes ### Food & Consumables **Fish** (Largest Category - 57 items) * Comprehensive variety of fish species * Primary food source and trading commodity * Different rarity and value tiers **Farming Products** * 21 different crops and agricultural products * Sustainable food sources * Ingredients for cooking and alchemy **Foraging Items** * 29 wild-gathered resources * Seasonal and location-specific items * Mix of food and crafting materials ### Specialized Resources **Hunting Materials** * 28 different hunting-related resources * Animal products and combat materials * Used for equipment and consumables **Combat Resources** * Specialized materials for warfare * Ammunition and tactical supplies **Ingredients & Miscellaneous** * Unique crafting components * Special-purpose materials * Quest-related items ## Quick Access * **[📋 Complete Resources Index](/docs/resources)** - Browse all 212 resources with full details * **[🔍 Search Resources](/search)** - Find specific resources by name or category * **[📖 Individual Resource Pages](/docs/resources/individual)** - Detailed information for each resource * **[🏠 Main Documentation](/docs)** - Return to documentation home ## Resource Statistics | Category | Count | Price Range | Primary Use | |----------|-------|-------------|-------------| | Fish | 57 | Varies | Food, Trading | | Foraging | 29 | Low-Medium | Food, Crafting | | Hunting | 28 | Medium | Combat, Crafting | | Farming | 21 | Low-Medium | Food, Ingredients | | Gems | 18 | High | Trinketry, Decoration | | Miscellaneous | 14 | Varies | Special Purposes | | Ores | 7 | Low-Medium | Base Materials | | Bars | 7 | Medium | Refined Materials | | Logs | 7 | Low-Medium | Construction | | Planks | 7 | Medium | Construction | | Tool Parts | 6 | Medium-High | Tool Crafting | | Handles | 6 | Medium | Tool Assembly | | Combat | 4 | Medium-High | Warfare | | Ingredients | 1 | Medium | Alchemy | *Last updated: {new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0]} - Total: 212 resources*

title: Complete Skills Catalog
description: Master all 15 skills in Stepcraft - from gathering and crafting to combat and social abilities with 0 total recipes
content:
# Skills Overview Develop your character through 15 diverse skills across multiple categories. Each skill offers unique recipes, abilities, and progression paths that shape your gameplay experience.

Gathering

6 Skills

Crafting

6 Skills

Combat

2 Skills

Social

1 Skills

## Skill Progression System All skills in Stepcraft follow a consistent progression system: * **Base XP per Level**: 100 XP (most skills) * **Growth Factor**: 1.1x multiplier per level * **Recipe Unlocks**: New recipes become available at specific level thresholds * **Tool Requirements**: Higher-tier recipes require better tools and equipment ### Level Tiers | Tier | Level Range | XP Reward | Recipes Unlocked | |:----:|:-----------:|:---------:|:-----------------| | **T0** | 1-14 | 10-20 XP | Basic recipes, starter materials | | **T1** | 15-29 | 20-40 XP | Copper tier, improved efficiency | | **T2** | 30-44 | 40-80 XP | Iron tier, intermediate recipes | | **T3** | 45-59 | 80-160 XP | Silver tier, advanced materials | | **T4** | 60-74 | 160-320 XP | Gold tier, rare recipes | | **T5** | 75-89 | 320-640 XP | Blue tier, epic materials | | **T6** | 90+ | 640+ XP | Red tier, legendary recipes | ## Gathering Skills Skills focused on collecting raw materials and resources from the environment. | Skill | Name | Location | Recipes | Description | |:-----:|:-----|:---------|:-------:|:------------| | | **[Farming](/docs/skills/individual/farming)** | Farm | 0 | Cultivate crops and manage agricultural activities. Sustainable food production and resource management. | | | **[Fishing](/docs/skills/individual/fishing)** | River | 0 | Cast your line to catch various fish species from different water bodies. A peaceful way to gather food. | | | **[Foraging](/docs/skills/individual/foraging)** | Grove | 0 | Gather wild plants, mushrooms, and natural resources from the wilderness. Knowledge of nature is key. | | | **[Hunting](/docs/skills/individual/hunting)** | Hunting Table | 0 | Track and hunt wild animals for meat, hides, and other valuable materials. | | | **[Logging](/docs/skills/individual/woodcutting)** | Forest | 0 | Fell trees to obtain logs for construction and crafting. Different tree types yield different wood qualities. | | | **[Mining](/docs/skills/individual/mining)** | Mine | 0 | Extract valuable ores and gems from the earth using pickaxes. Higher skill levels unlock access to rare materials. | ## Crafting Skills Skills that transform raw materials into useful items, equipment, and consumables. | Skill | Name | Location | Recipes | Description | |:-----:|:-----|:---------|:-------:|:------------| | | **[Alchemy](/docs/skills/individual/alchemy)** | Alchemy Table | 0 | Brew powerful potions and elixirs using magical ingredients. Master alchemists can create miraculous concoctions. | | | **[Carpentry](/docs/skills/individual/carpentry)** | Workshop | 0 | Work with wood to create planks, handles, and wooden items. Essential for tool crafting and construction. | | | **[Cooking](/docs/skills/individual/cooking)** | Kitchen | 0 | Prepare delicious and nutritious meals from raw ingredients. Cooked food provides better health restoration. | | | **[Crafting](/docs/skills/individual/crafting)** | Workshop | 0 | Combine materials and components to create advanced tools, weapons, and equipment. | | | **[Smithing](/docs/skills/individual/smithing)** | Forge | 0 | Transform raw ores into refined bars and craft powerful weapons, armor, and tools at the forge. | | | **[Trinketry](/docs/skills/individual/trinketry)** | Trinket Table | 0 | Craft beautiful jewelry and accessories from precious gems and metals. | ## Combat Skills Skills related to fighting, defense, and physical prowess. | Skill | Name | Location | Recipes | Description | |:-----:|:-----|:---------|:-------:|:------------| | | **[Agility](/docs/skills/individual/agility)** | Training Grounds | 0 | Improve movement speed, reflexes, and dexterity through training and practice. | | | **[Combat](/docs/skills/individual/combat)** | Combat Table | 0 | Master the arts of war, weapon handling, and tactical combat skills. | ## Social Skills Skills that affect your relationships and standing with NPCs and factions. | Skill | Name | Location | Recipes | Description | |:-----:|:-----|:---------|:-------:|:------------| | | **[Reputation](/docs/skills/individual/reputation)** | Reputation Table | 0 | Build relationships with NPCs and factions. Higher reputation unlocks special opportunities and rewards. | ## Skill Synergies Many skills work together to create powerful synergies: * **Mining + Smithing**: Extract ores and smelt them into bars and tools * **Woodcutting + Carpentry**: Harvest logs and craft planks, handles, and wooden items * **Foraging + Alchemy**: Gather magical ingredients and brew powerful potions * **Fishing + Cooking**: Catch fresh fish and prepare nutritious meals * **Hunting + Crafting**: Obtain materials and create specialized equipment ## Navigation * [🔍 Search All Skills](/search) - Find specific skills and recipes * [📝 Individual Skill Pages](/docs/skills/individual) - Detailed guides for each skill * [🏠 Back to Documentation](/docs) - Return to main documentation *Catalog updated 2025-07-26 - 15 skills with 0 total recipes*

title: Agility
description: Master the Agility skill in Stepcraft - improve movement speed, reflexes, and dexterity through training and practice
content:
# Agility

Improve movement speed, reflexes, and dexterity through training and practice. Enhanced mobility and combat effectiveness.

| 10x [Red Toolhead](/docs/resources/individual/red_toolhead) | 1x [Tempest Staff](/docs/resources/individual/tempest_staff) | 640 | 200 | ### Recipe Tiers Recipes are organized into tiers based on level requirements: * **Basic (T0)** (Levels 1-14): 9 recipes * **Copper (T1)** (Levels 15-29): 8 recipes * **Iron (T2)** (Levels 30-44): 8 recipes * **Silver (T3)** (Levels 45-59): 8 recipes * **Gold (T4)** (Levels 60-74): 8 recipes * **Blue (T5)** (Levels 75-89): 8 recipes * **Red (T6)** (Levels 90+): 11 recipes ### Progression Tips * Start with basic recipes to build your skill level * Higher-tier recipes require better tools and provide more XP * Some recipes unlock access to rare materials and advanced crafting * Focus on recipes that produce items you need for other skills ## Skill Synergies **Smithing** for metal components • **Carpentry** for wooden parts • **All skills** benefit from crafted tools ## Leveling Guide ### Early Levels (1-15) * Focus on basic recipes and activities * Learn the fundamentals of Crafting * Gather essential materials and tools ### Mid Levels (16-60) * Unlock intermediate recipes and techniques * Improve efficiency and quality * Access better materials and tools ### Advanced Levels (61-90+) * Master complex recipes and legendary items * Achieve maximum efficiency and rare material access * Unlock exclusive content and rewards ## Related Content * [📋 Complete Skills Catalog](/docs/skills) - Browse all skills * [🔍 Search Skills](/search) - Find specific recipes and techniques * [📝 Crafting Skills](/docs/skills#crafting) - Browse similar skills ## Navigation * [← Back to Skills Catalog](/docs/skills) * [Browse Crafting Skills](/docs/skills#crafting) * [Search All Skills](/search)

title: Hunting
description: Master the Hunting skill in Stepcraft - track and hunt wild animals for meat, hides, and other valuable materials
content:
# Hunting

Track and hunt wild animals for meat, hides, and other valuable materials. Requires patience and combat skills.

**Category:** Gathering **Location:** Hunting Table **Tool:** Bow **Recipes:** 20
## Skill Details | Property | Value | |----------|-------| | **Skill Name** | Hunting | | **Skill Key** | `hunting` | | **Category** | Gathering | | **XP per Level** | 100 | | **Growth Factor** | 1.1x | | **Location** | Hunting Table | | **Primary Tool** | Bow | | **Total Recipes** | 20 | ## Training Location **Hunting Table** is where you'll practice and develop your Hunting skills. This location provides the necessary environment and facilities for skill training. ## Recipes Master these 20 recipes to advance your Hunting skill: ### Recipe List | Recipe | Level | Tool | Inputs | Outputs | XP | Steps | |:-------|:-----:|:----:|:-------|:--------|:--:|:-----:| | **[Hunt Bird 1](/docs/resources/individual/bird_1)** | - | - | None | 1x [Bird 1](/docs/resources/individual/bird_1) | 10 | 50 | | **[Skin Bird 1](/docs/resources/individual/bird_1_meat)** | - | - | 2x [Bird 1](/docs/resources/individual/bird_1) | 1x [Bird 1 Meat](/docs/resources/individual/bird_1_meat) | 10 | 50 | | **[Hunt Bird 2](/docs/resources/individual/bird_2)** | Lv. 15 | - | None | 1x [Bird 2](/docs/resources/individual/bird_2) | 20 | 75 | | **[Skin Bird 2](/docs/resources/individual/bird_2_meat)** | Lv. 15 | - | 1x [Bird 2](/docs/resources/individual/bird_2) | 1x [Bird 2 Meat](/docs/resources/individual/bird_2_meat)
1x [Bird 2 Feather](/docs/resources/individual/bird_2_feather) | 20 | 75 | | **[Hunt Squirrel](/docs/resources/individual/squirrel)** | Lv. 30 | - | None | 1x [Squirrel](/docs/resources/individual/squirrel) | 40 | 100 | | **[Skin Squirrel](/docs/resources/individual/squirrel_meat)** | Lv. 30 | - | 2x [Squirrel](/docs/resources/individual/squirrel) | 1x [Squirrel Meat](/docs/resources/individual/squirrel_meat)
1x [Squirrel Hide](/docs/resources/individual/squirrel_hide) | 40 | 100 | | **[Hunt Rabbit](/docs/resources/individual/rabbit)** | Lv. 45 | - | None | 1x [Rabbit](/docs/resources/individual/rabbit) | 80 | 125 | | **[Skin Rabbit](/docs/resources/individual/rabbit_hide)** | Lv. 45 | - | 2x [Rabbit](/docs/resources/individual/rabbit) | 1x [Rabbit Hide](/docs/resources/individual/rabbit_hide) | 80 | 125 | | **[Hunt Hog](/docs/resources/individual/hog)** | Lv. 45 | - | None | 1x [Hog](/docs/resources/individual/hog) | 80 | 125 | | **[Skin Hog](/docs/resources/individual/hog_hide)** | Lv. 45 | - | 2x [Hog](/docs/resources/individual/hog) | 1x [Hog Hide](/docs/resources/individual/hog_hide) | 80 | 125 | | **[Hunt Fox](/docs/resources/individual/fox)** | Lv. 60 | - | None | 1x [Fox](/docs/resources/individual/fox) | 160 | 150 | | **[Skin Fox](/docs/resources/individual/fox_meat)** | Lv. 60 | - | 2x [Fox](/docs/resources/individual/fox) | 1x [Fox Meat](/docs/resources/individual/fox_meat)
1x [Fox Hide](/docs/resources/individual/fox_hide) | 160 | 150 | | **[Hunt Deer](/docs/resources/individual/deer)** | Lv. 60 | - | None | 1x [Deer](/docs/resources/individual/deer) | 160 | 150 | | **[Skin Deer](/docs/resources/individual/deer_meat)** | Lv. 60 | - | 2x [Deer](/docs/resources/individual/deer) | 1x [Deer Meat](/docs/resources/individual/deer_meat)
1x [Deer Hide](/docs/resources/individual/deer_hide) | 160 | 150 | | **[Hunt Moose](/docs/resources/individual/moose)** | Lv. 75 | - | None | 1x [Moose](/docs/resources/individual/moose) | 320 | 175 | | **[Skin Moose](/docs/resources/individual/moose_hide)** | Lv. 75 | - | 2x [Moose](/docs/resources/individual/moose) | 1x [Moose Hide](/docs/resources/individual/moose_hide) | 320 | 175 | | **[Hunt Wolf](/docs/resources/individual/wolf)** | Lv. 75 | - | None | 1x [Wolf](/docs/resources/individual/wolf) | 320 | 175 | | **[Skin Wolf](/docs/resources/individual/wolf_meat)** | Lv. 75 | - | 2x [Wolf](/docs/resources/individual/wolf) | 1x [Wolf Meat](/docs/resources/individual/wolf_meat)

title: Mining
description: Master the Mining skill in Stepcraft - extract valuable ores and gems from the earth using pickaxes
content:
# Mining

Extract valuable ores and gems from the earth using pickaxes. Higher skill levels unlock access to rare materials and deeper mining locations.

**Category:** Gathering **Location:** Mine **Tool:** Pickaxe **Recipes:** 7
## Skill Details | Property | Value | |----------|-------| | **Skill Name** | Mining | | **Skill Key** | `mining` | | **Category** | Gathering | | **XP per Level** | 100 | | **Growth Factor** | 1.1x | | **Location** | Mine | | **Primary Tool** | Pickaxe | | **Total Recipes** | 7 | ## Training Location **Mine** is where you'll practice and develop your Mining skills. This location provides the necessary environment and facilities for skill training. ## Recipes Master these 7 recipes to advance your Mining skill: ### Recipe List | Recipe | Level | Tool | Inputs | Outputs | XP | Steps | |:-------|:-----:|:----:|:-------|:--------|:--:|:-----:| | **[Mine Stone](/docs/resources/individual/stone)** | - | - | None | 1x [Stone](/docs/resources/individual/stone) | 10 | 50 | | **[Mine Copper Ore](/docs/resources/individual/copper_ore)** | Lv. 15 | - | None | 1x [Copper Ore](/docs/resources/individual/copper_ore) | 20 | 75 | | **[Mine Iron Ore](/docs/resources/individual/iron_ore)** | Lv. 30 | copper | None | 1x [Iron Ore](/docs/resources/individual/iron_ore) | 40 | 100 | | **[Mine Silver Ore](/docs/resources/individual/silver_ore)** | Lv. 45 | iron | None | 1x [Silver Ore](/docs/resources/individual/silver_ore) | 80 | 125 | | **[Mine Gold Ore](/docs/resources/individual/gold_ore)** | Lv. 60 | silver | None | 1x [Gold Ore](/docs/resources/individual/gold_ore) | 160 | 150 | | **[Mine Blue Ore](/docs/resources/individual/blue_ore)** | Lv. 75 | gold | None | 1x [Blue Ore](/docs/resources/individual/blue_ore) | 320 | 175 | | **[Mine Red Ore](/docs/resources/individual/red_ore)** | Lv. 90 | blue | None | 1x [Red Ore](/docs/resources/individual/red_ore) | 640 | 200 | ### Recipe Tiers Recipes are organized into tiers based on level requirements: * **Basic (T0)** (Levels 1-14): 1 recipes * **Copper (T1)** (Levels 15-29): 1 recipes * **Iron (T2)** (Levels 30-44): 1 recipes * **Silver (T3)** (Levels 45-59): 1 recipes * **Gold (T4)** (Levels 60-74): 1 recipes * **Blue (T5)** (Levels 75-89): 1 recipes * **Red (T6)** (Levels 90+): 1 recipes ### Progression Tips * Start with basic recipes to build your skill level * Higher-tier recipes require better tools and provide more XP * Some recipes unlock access to rare materials and advanced crafting * Focus on recipes that produce items you need for other skills ## Skill Synergies **Smithing** to process ores into bars • **Trinketry** to cut and polish gems • **Crafting** to create mining tools ## Leveling Guide ### Early Levels (1-15) * Focus on basic recipes and activities * Learn the fundamentals of Mining * Gather essential materials and tools ### Mid Levels (16-60) * Unlock intermediate recipes and techniques * Improve efficiency and quality * Access better materials and tools ### Advanced Levels (61-90+) * Master complex recipes and legendary items * Achieve maximum efficiency and rare material access * Unlock exclusive content and rewards ## Related Content * [📋 Complete Skills Catalog](/docs/skills) - Browse all skills * [🔍 Search Skills](/search) - Find specific recipes and techniques * [📝 Gathering Skills](/docs/skills#gathering) - Browse similar skills ## description: Master the Reputation skill in Stepcraft - build relationships with npcs and factions throughout the world
content:
# Reputation

Build relationships with NPCs and factions throughout the world. Higher reputation unlocks special opportunities and exclusive rewards.

**Category:** Social **Location:** Reputation Table **Tool:** Reputation Table **Recipes:** 0
## Skill Details | Property | Value | |----------|-------| | **Skill Name** | Reputation | | **Skill Key** | `reputation` | | **Category** | Social | | **XP per Level** | 100 | | **Growth Factor** | 1.1x | | **Location** | Reputation Table | | **Primary Tool** | Reputation Table | | **Total Recipes** | 0 | ## Training Location **Reputation Table** is where you'll practice and develop your Reputation skills. This location provides the necessary environment and facilities for skill training. ## Available Activities This skill focuses on activities rather than traditional recipes: * **Practice regularly** at Reputation Table * **Use appropriate tools** (Reputation Table) for best results * **Explore different areas** to discover new opportunities * **Build relationships** that can enhance your skill development ## Skill Synergies **Trading** for better prices • **All skills** for NPC interactions • **Quests** for faction relationships ## Leveling Guide ### Early Levels (1-15) * Focus on basic recipes and activities * Learn the fundamentals of Reputation * Gather essential materials and tools ### Mid Levels (16-60) * Unlock intermediate recipes and techniques * Improve efficiency and quality * Access better materials and tools ### Advanced Levels (61-90+) * Master complex recipes and legendary items * Achieve maximum efficiency and rare material access * Unlock exclusive content and rewards ## Related Content * [📋 Complete Skills Catalog](/docs/skills) - Browse all skills * [🔍 Search Skills](/search) - Find specific recipes and techniques * [📝 Social Skills](/docs/skills#social) - Browse similar skills ## Navigation * [← Back to Skills Catalog](/docs/skills) * [Browse Social Skills](/docs/skills#social) * [Search All Skills](/search)

title: Smithing
description: Master the Smithing skill in Stepcraft - transform raw ores into refined bars and craft powerful weapons, armor, and tools at the forge
content:
# Smithing

Transform raw ores into refined bars and craft powerful weapons, armor, and tools at the forge. Master smiths can create legendary equipment.

**Category:** Crafting **Location:** Forge **Tool:** Hammer **Recipes:** 26
## Skill Details | Property | Value | |----------|-------| | **Skill Name** | Smithing | | **Skill Key** | `smithing` | | **Category** | Crafting | | **XP per Level** | 100 | | **Growth Factor** | 1.1x | | **Location** | Forge | | **Primary Tool** | Hammer | | **Total Recipes** | 26 | ## Training Location **Forge** is where you'll practice and develop your Smithing skills. This location provides the necessary environment and facilities for skill training. ## Recipes Master these 26 recipes to advance your Smithing skill: ### Recipe List | Recipe | Level | Tool | Inputs | Outputs | XP | Steps | |:-------|:-----:|:----:|:-------|:--------|:--:|:-----:| | **[Carve Stone Brick](/docs/resources/individual/stone_brick)** | - | 5x [Red Bar](/docs/resources/individual/red_bar) | 1x [Red Shield](/docs/items/individual/red_shield) | 640 | 200 | | **[Smelt Red Sword](/docs/items/individual/red_sword)** | Lv. 90 | - | 2x [Red Bar](/docs/resources/individual/red_bar) | 1x [Red Sword](/docs/items/individual/red_sword) | 640 | 200 | ### Recipe Tiers Recipes are organized into tiers based on level requirements: * **Basic (T0)** (Levels 1-14): 2 recipes * **Copper (T1)** (Levels 15-29): 4 recipes * **Iron (T2)** (Levels 30-44): 4 recipes * **Silver (T3)** (Levels 45-59): 4 recipes * **Gold (T4)** (Levels 60-74): 4 recipes * **Blue (T5)** (Levels 75-89): 4 recipes * **Red (T6)** (Levels 90+): 4 recipes ### Progression Tips * Start with basic recipes to build your skill level * Higher-tier recipes require better tools and provide more XP * Some recipes unlock access to rare materials and advanced crafting * Focus on recipes that produce items you need for other skills ## Skill Synergies **Mining** for raw ore materials • **Crafting** to combine components • **Combat** to wield crafted weapons effectively ## Leveling Guide ### Early Levels (1-15) * Focus on basic recipes and activities * Learn the fundamentals of Smithing * Gather essential materials and tools ### Mid Levels (16-60) * Unlock intermediate recipes and techniques * Improve efficiency and quality * Access better materials and tools ### Advanced Levels (61-90+) * Master complex recipes and legendary items * Achieve maximum efficiency and rare material access * Unlock exclusive content and rewards ## Related Content * [📋 Complete Skills Catalog](/docs/skills) - Browse all skills * [🔍 Search Skills](/search) - Find specific recipes and techniques * [📝 Crafting Skills](/docs/skills#crafting) - Browse similar skills ## Navigation * [← Back to Skills Catalog](/docs/skills) * [Browse Crafting Skills](/docs/skills#crafting) * [Search All Skills](/search)

5x [Moonwell Opal](/docs/resources/individual/moonwell_opal) | 1x [Crimson Star](/docs/resources/individual/crimson_star) | 640 | 200 | ### Recipe Tiers Recipes are organized into tiers based on level requirements: * **Basic (T0)** (Levels 1-14): 6 recipes * **Copper (T1)** (Levels 15-29): 5 recipes * **Iron (T2)** (Levels 30-44): 11 recipes * **Silver (T3)** (Levels 45-59): 20 recipes * **Gold (T4)** (Levels 60-74): 15 recipes * **Blue (T5)** (Levels 75-89): 15 recipes * **Red (T6)** (Levels 90+): 14 recipes ### Progression Tips * Start with basic recipes to build your skill level * Higher-tier recipes require better tools and provide more XP * Some recipes unlock access to rare materials and advanced crafting * Focus on recipes that produce items you need for other skills ## Skill Synergies **Mining** for precious gems • **Smithing** for metal settings • **Trading** for valuable jewelry ## Leveling Guide ### Early Levels (1-15) * Focus on basic recipes and activities * Learn the fundamentals of Trinketry * Gather essential materials and tools ### Mid Levels (16-60) * Unlock intermediate recipes and techniques * Improve efficiency and quality * Access better materials and tools ### Advanced Levels (61-90+) * Master complex recipes and legendary items * Achieve maximum efficiency and rare material access * Unlock exclusive content and rewards ## Related Content * [📋 Complete Skills Catalog](/docs/skills) - Browse all skills * [🔍 Search Skills](/search) - Find specific recipes and techniques * [📝 Crafting Skills](/docs/skills#crafting) - Browse similar skills ## Navigation * [← Back to Skills Catalog](/docs/skills) * [Browse Crafting Skills](/docs/skills#crafting) * [Search All Skills](/search)

title: Logging
description: Master the Logging skill in Stepcraft - fell trees to obtain logs for construction and crafting
content:
# Logging

Fell trees to obtain logs for construction and crafting. Different tree types yield different wood qualities and rarities.

**Category:** Gathering **Location:** Forest **Tool:** Axe **Recipes:** 7
## Skill Details | Property | Value | |----------|-------| | **Skill Name** | Logging | | **Skill Key** | `woodcutting` | | **Category** | Gathering | | **XP per Level** | 100 | | **Growth Factor** | 1.1x | | **Location** | Forest | | **Primary Tool** | Axe | | **Total Recipes** | 7 | ## Training Location **Forest** is where you'll practice and develop your Logging skills. This location provides the necessary environment and facilities for skill training. ## Recipes Master these 7 recipes to advance your Logging skill: ### Recipe List | Recipe | Level | Tool | Inputs | Outputs | XP | Steps | |:-------|:-----:|:----:|:-------|:--------|:--:|:-----:| | **[Chop Sticks](/docs/resources/individual/sticks)** | - | - | None | 2x [Sticks](/docs/resources/individual/sticks) | 10 | 50 | | **[Chop Birch Log](/docs/resources/individual/birch_log)** | Lv. 15 | - | None | 1x [Birch Log](/docs/resources/individual/birch_log) | 20 | 75 | | **[Chop Oak Log](/docs/resources/individual/oak_log)** | Lv. 30 | copper | None | 1x [Oak Log](/docs/resources/individual/oak_log) | 40 | 100 | | **[Chop Pine Log](/docs/resources/individual/pine_log)** | Lv. 30 | iron | None | 1x [Pine Log](/docs/resources/individual/pine_log) | 40 | 100 | | **[Chop Redwood Log](/docs/resources/individual/redwood_log)** | Lv. 45 | silver | None | 1x [Redwood Log](/docs/resources/individual/redwood_log) | 80 | 125 | | **[Chop Silverleaf Log](/docs/resources/individual/silverleaf_log)** | Lv. 45 | gold | None | 1x [Silverleaf Log](/docs/resources/individual/silverleaf_log) | 80 | 125 | | **[Chop Eldritchwood Log](/docs/resources/individual/eldritchwood_log)** | Lv. 60 | blue | None | 1x [Eldritchwood Log](/docs/resources/individual/eldritchwood_log) | 160 | 150 | ### Recipe Tiers Recipes are organized into tiers based on level requirements: * **Basic (T0)** (Levels 1-14): 1 recipes * **Copper (T1)** (Levels 15-29): 1 recipes * **Iron (T2)** (Levels 30-44): 2 recipes * **Silver (T3)** (Levels 45-59): 2 recipes * **Gold (T4)** (Levels 60-74): 1 recipes ### Progression Tips * Start with basic recipes to build your skill level * Higher-tier recipes require better tools and provide more XP * Some recipes unlock access to rare materials and advanced crafting * Focus on recipes that produce items you need for other skills ##
